Topic.Title: Anyone know if Silver Lake is still interested in bidding on Yahoo?

Message.Msg: Silver Lake had $14 billion of assets under management about a year ago. With Yahoo's market cap north of $20 billion your thesis seems improbable.

Topic.Title: Anyone know if Silver Lake is still interested in bidding on Yahoo?

Message.Msg: Too late !

Topic.Title: Anyone know if Silver Lake is still interested in bidding on Yahoo?

Message.Msg: NOBODY is going to "bid" for Yahoo. Ever. Not after the Microsoft fiasco. Given the new board, I could see them accept a negotiated offer at the right price but with a new CEO, I think that is some time away. My guess is still that the only way to acquire Yahoo is with an unfriendly tender, but given the track record, lack of vision, incompetent managemen and questionable future, it is hard to see who would buy it.

Topic.Title: Alibaba Group IPO - Don't take your eye off the ball...

Message.Msg: After Yahoo buys back $3 billion in shares the boost to Yahoo's share price from an Alibaba Group IPO will be about $15 to $23/share before taxes. Corporate repatriation legislation proposed by Senators Kay Hagan and John McCain would let U.S. businesses bring home offshore profits at an 8.75 percent tax rate.

Message.Title: I sold my YHOO shares and here is why Please read and comment
Message.Msg: I was long YHOO for a long time and I sold my shares a couple of days ago and here are my reasons: 1- YHOO hit 52 weeks high after earning announement and popped from 15.5 to 17.50 and we should expect a pull back 2- Market is worried about fiscal cliff and no matter how good YHOO is, it will go down with the market 3- Arbirtage traders will sell YHOO and buy quality stocks that have come down a lot and there is a great hope that they will rebound faster than YHOO. 4- Europe problem is coming up again and now Germany is feeling the pich I don't believe it will be rewarding to be long YHOO specially if you are making money in your position. I will wait till the state of union in 2013 and YHOO next Q when everything is clear. Note: I am not trying to scare you to sell your shares. This is just my strategy as a trader with 17 years of experience.

Message.Title: Yahoo: Buy The Breakout
Message.Msg: For the first time in several years, it appears as though Yahoo! (YHOO) may be entering a period of growing share price. The current performance of YHOO is around a 9% year-to-date gain and in the future prices could continue marching upwards. Through this article, I will present the bullish case that YHOO is breaking out of a multi-year malaise and share price could reach new highs in the near future. Seeking Alpha

Topic.Title: I sold my YHOO shares and here is why Please read and comment

Message.Msg: Let me clarify item 3 on arbitrage traders. When an arbitrage trader sees YHOo has gone up but say for example AAPL has fallen hard, he shorts YHOO and buys AAPL. then lets say both go up but he believes YHOO will go up only 1% but AAPL should recover 4% so he would profit 3%. Lets assume both go down, he would expect AAPL to go down only 1% because it has already dropped a lot but YHOO will pull back more so he still makes money. So an arbitrage sells a stock which has be up and a pull back is expected and buys a "quality" stock which has dropped recently and a recovery is expected.

Topic.Title: I sold my YHOO shares and here is why Please read and comment

Message.Title: Yahoo Japan signs tie-up agreement with Gree, Nikkei reports
Message.Msg: Yahoo! Japan signs tie-up agreement with Gree, Nikkei reports Yahoo Japan (YHOO) has signed a business tie-up agreement with Gree, the Nikkei reports. Under the terms of the deal, Yahoo will provide Gree's social networking games on its website for smartphone users, while Gree will use Yahoo's settlement service, Yahoo! Wallet, to help its users buy in-game items
